channel.title: Add Mac Compatibility
channel.description:
Now that iOS app sideloading for M1 Macs is blocked please add legitimate support for Auxy Pro on Mac or make a new version and charge separately for it... whatever ya'll want, but the people need Auxy Pro on Mac! ü§ç! [Screen Shot 2021-01-18 at 1.43.09 PM|690x388](upload://43imDiKp4bQBeY0XJfx3EvzS9JQ.jpeg)
Did anyone else have the chance to add Auxy to their M1 Macs using iMazing or Apple Configurator 2??

item.title: Add Mac Compatibility
item.dc:creator: iammane
item.description:
jmoore104:

I bought an M1 Mac so I could use Auxy on it

Woof.

All kidding aside the devs need to opt in, that‚Äôs just how it is. It‚Äôs to allow a developer or team to make necessary changes to their app so that it won‚Äôt be a nightmare to use with a mouse/keyboard/midi controller. I can‚Äôt really see the appeal of trying to use an app specifically built for touch screen with a keyboard and mouse.

You can test what the experience would be like. Sync a Bluetooth mouse and keyboard to your phone or iPad, turn on mouse in settings and give it a whirl. It‚Äôs gonna be like trying to drive a car with cinder blocks on your hands.

And there‚Äôs no midi in anyway, but that‚Äôs a whole different thing.

AFAIK the only apps with really good M1 support are AUM, Drambo and both Moog synths (Model 15 and Model D).

But honestly, if you‚Äôre working on a desktop grade machine now it makes more sense to explore desktop grade software. Ymmv

Read full topic

item.title: Add Mac Compatibility
item.dc:creator: jmoore104
item.description:
I bought an M1 Mac so I could use Auxy on it, but it just doesn‚Äôt seem possible. Wasn‚Äôt this supposed to be the promise of the M1 chip? Why would Auxy need to ‚Äúadd‚Äù compatibility when it‚Äôs supposed to be automatic? It seems more likely that they‚Äôve somehow blocked Mac downloads while they pursue it as another revenue stream. I wish I‚Äôd checked beforehand but I believed Apple‚Äôs promises me of instant compatibility.
